terms.definition: A system that tracks and manages changes to documents or code over time, allowing users to see revision history and revert to previous versions if needed.
Software as a Service - a cloud-based software delivery model where applications are hosted remotely and accessed via the internet rather than installed locally.
A centralized repository of information, documentation, and resources that provides answers to common questions and solutions to problems.
Detailed written materials that explain how to use, maintain, or understand technical products, systems, or processes.
Official records and reports that demonstrate adherence to industry regulations, standards, and legal requirements.
A unified system where all documents are stored in a single, accessible location rather than scattered across multiple platforms or storage systems.
The ability for multiple users to simultaneously edit, comment on, and share documents with changes visible instantly to all participants.
A centralized storage system or database where documents are organized, stored, and managed for easy retrieval and access.
The capability of a platform to create, manage, and display content in multiple languages for global accessibility.
Digital documentation that includes clickable elements, embedded media, and dynamic content to enhance user engagement and understanding.
Application Programming Interface - a set of protocols and tools that allow different software applications to communicate and share data with each other.
A chronological record of document changes, access, and activities that provides accountability and traceability for compliance purposes.
Software or documentation designed to function properly and be easily accessible on mobile devices like smartphones and tablets.
The structured process that defines how documents are created, reviewed, approved, and distributed within an organization.
Product Lifecycle Management - software systems that manage product data and processes throughout a product's entire lifecycle from conception to disposal.
